column4: hello, i just installed ubuntu on a centrino alienware 1.6ghz 1gb ram 60gb 7200rpm hdd but it runs painfully slow.  i upgraded to the 686 kernel.  the cpu load is 100% and hdd is constantly spinning until i kill any acpi/power related processes.  but even afterwards it still feels sluggish.  any help is appreciated.
I have the same situation... but it runs fine for me
what do you mean?
I'm on an alienware laptop 1.6 centrino, however mine seems to be running faster than windows was on this before...
interesting, did you do any setup/config on ubuntu??
nope, took about half an hour to install
mine took more than 2
only problem i have is the 2.6.15 kernel has a broken touchpad driver
i'm running 2.6.12 686
im running the 386 kernel
interesting
would it be a good idea to try and reinstall it??
if you think it's slow, i would try the 386
i was running the 386, somebody on the forums suggested i go to 686 and it helped a tiny bit but nothing significant
that seems weird
i'm pulling down the dvd image and i'll try again
doesn't it fit on a cd?
it does
how much ram do you have?
thanks for your help man i'm going to try and do a reinstall
good luck
